Uncountable

A portfolio of works and interests.

View On GitHub

    Welcome to my github page. This is a space I use to share various projects and ideas I’ve developed over the years. Enjoy!

    Teaching and Pedagogy

    A collection of teaching and pedagogical resources developed teaching mathematics at a small liberal arts college in the United States since 1996.

    Phone Sensor Math

    Here is the Phone Sensor Math site dedicated to ways in which ordinary smart phone sensors (e.g. GPS, accelerometer, etc) can be used to collect data for analysis in calculus and physics classes. Developed with the help of Ally Collier.

    Mastery Vector Calculus

    In Fall of 2020, we taught completely on-line because of the covid pandemic. Here is the Mastery-based Vector Calculus that relies on the MAA’s open-source, on-line homework system, WeBWorK, and the open-source Calculus 3 textbook from OpenStax.
